Olivier Assayas' film stars Asia Argento as a woman who had a relationship with Michael Madsen. Madsen is a business man who buys and sells sex in pairs: premium hookers and no-good D-list celebrities – the kind that pay an escort far more than going on limo runs around the city. Things get nasty when one of his friends has a client overdose, allegedly, on drugs tainted with AIDS virus and potentially six boys are infected.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them is solely related to an unseen and ancient race: The half-African/Bantu and possible South African/African-American alien creatures kidnaps people to vivisect, hence steal organs, because their race once abducted by some immensely powerful sand biking posse.

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, Jerry MEA Culpa falls off a building trying to prove his super-sized ego. Meanwhile, Tom picks up stray kittens in order to get out of unemployment line - only two feet tall cuties should be free food!

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie was decent produced though.
Definitely not worth to watch.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless action film. In Canada stopping for gasoline, Joe goes to the washroom but ends up knocked out. When he comes to, he steals and army jeep and speeds off without any apparent explanation of how or why - fortunately his epileptic convulsions explain it all and allow him to get away scott free.
